results.title: Experience Indonesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Independent traveller Mark Crowdy, avoiding the more popular tourist resorts, travels to the lesser known eastern islands of Flores, Komodo, Amban and Banda. His ultimate aim was “to find people and places who hadn’t been jaded by tourism.” The Lonely Planet travel series opens up new possibilities in travelling for the intrepid explorer, while armchair travellers can sit back in comfort and enjoy rare and beautiful locations.

results.title: Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands
results.creator_credit: Peter Boyd MacLean, Caroline Stuart and Pilot Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Justine Shapiro travels off the beaten track on a tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos Islands. She visits hot springs heated by a volcano, views the countryside from the roof of a train and almost tries roast guinea pig. A highlight of the journey is a visit to the Amazon forest, guided by the indigenous people of the area. The Galapagos Islands were made famous by Charles Darwin in developing his theory of evolution and are home to a fascinating diversity of wildlife, with many species found nowhere else in the world.

results.title: Absolutely fabulous
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman and BBC
results.brief_description: Absolutely fabulous is one of the most successful British comedy shows; an hilarious situation comedy that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp. Edwina (Jennifer Saunders) is a baby-boomer mother, fashion victim extraordinaire. Her best friend is the cocaine-snorting nymphomaniac Patsy (Joanna Lumley). Part of the show’s success comes from its reversal of roles. It is the practical long-suffering Saffie, Edwina’s daughter, who sweeps up after her mother, and the in-your-face portrayal of drug-taking, sex-loving, materialistic women who are spoilt, selfish, vacuous but undeniably good fun. Always colourful, often brilliant, “Absolutely fabulous” confirmed Saunders and co-writer Dawn French as two of the best comedians of their generation.

results.title: Absolutely fabulous. Series 3
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman, BBC and Saunders and French
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Absolutely fabulous”.
Three episodes from series 3 of the popular British comedy series, “Absolutely fabulous”, a hilarious satire, set in the London fashion world, that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp. “Door handle”: In need of an overhaul, Eddie sets about getting fit, renovating the kitchen and uses an electronic organiser to get her life in order. Meanwhile, Patsy is concerned for her health and turns to Saffie for advice. In a desperate search for the perfect door handle, the pair fly to New York. “Happy new year”: Eddie decides that her New Year’s Eve resolution is to have more fun. Hence, she and Patsy plan a night on the tiles. Much to Eddie’s chagrin, Patsy’s glamorous and estranged sister joins them. “Sex”: Eddie and Patsy reminisce about their wild sexual exploits in the 1960s and 70s; Eddie determines to get in touch with her sexual side by hiring a male prostitute. Saffie and her study group prepare their genetics and ethics lecture.

results.title: Absolutely fabulous: the last shout. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Bob Spiers, Jon Plowman, Janice Thomas, BBC and Saunders and French
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Absolutely fabulous”.
Absolutely fabulous, the popular British comedy series, conceived by Jennifer Saunders and Dawn French, is a hilarious satire that plays with elements of the absurd and high camp, set in the cutting edge world of fashion design. Episode “The Last shout” - parts one and two. Part one: Eddie has adopted a dolphin that she is using to cleanse her aura and assist her in losing weight. Having vacated her room above the bottle shop, Patsy is homeless and turns to Eddie for support. The pair decide to head off on a skiing holiday where Eddie has a near-death experience and a chat with God (Marianne Faithful) about fashion. Meanwhile, Saffie has become engaged to an over bearing poser, Paolo. Part two: Eddie’s near death experience has left her questioning her existence and she is operating in an altered state. Saffie starts to fold under the pressures of organising the wedding, and suffers from pre-nuptial jitters. Paolo’s parents arrive to meet Eddie, who upon discovering that they are from an important and rich family, seeks to impress them with her charms, causing disaster all round. Cast also includes Joanna Lumley, Julia Sawalha, June Whitfield.

results.title: From spirit to spirit (A)
results.creator_credit: Blackfella Films, Four Winds, Min Govat Productions, Nga Kara Whetu, TopShelf Productions and Great North
results.brief_description: An international co-production recognising the indigenous peoples of Australia, Canada, New Zealand and Sweden, made by indigenous filmmakers. The episodes reflect the amazing diversity of cultural tradition and heritage of indigenous communities.

results.title: Visit from Africa
results.creator_credit: James Cullingham, Gil Cardinal, Andy Thomson, Tamarack Productions and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
Documents the visit of two South Africans to Cree tribes in Northern Quebec, Canada, showing how indigenous people forge links to make a better future for themselves by discussing relevant issues.

results.title: Keepers of the fire
results.creator_credit: Nola Wuttunee, Brenda Hennig, Andy Thomson and Great North Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
This program focuses on the work of four Elders from a North American Indian tribe in Canada, who were survivors of the prison system. After leaving the reserves, it is not uncommon for those who had made the move to the city, to become caught in a vicious cycle within the criminal justice system. The Elders attempt to work with young offenders using their own experiences and knowledge of the traditional way of life, to educate the young people into developing a sense of self worth and hopefully prevent them from becoming caught in a similar cycle.

results.title: Making waves = Te upoko o te ika
results.creator_credit: Whetu Fala, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
The story of the Te Upoko o te ika, Maori radio station in Wellington, New Zealand. The station fights to survive in a world where ratings and market share are paramount. This program captures one day in the life of a radio station which aims to bring Maori traditions, language and culture to the modern world.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Whetu Fala, Carol J Paewai, TopShelf Productions and Nga Kara Whetu

results.title: Mungo lady (A)
results.creator_credit: Mari Bennett, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “From spirit to spirit (A)”.
In 1960 the remains of an Aboriginal woman were exhumed at Lake Mungo, NSW by the white anthropologist/archaeologist, Alan Thorne. The woman had been cremated at least 25,000 years ago, providing the first evidence of this practice, and evidence for elaborate funerary customs by Aborigines in pre-historic times. The remains were exhibited around the world, before being returned to the Aborigines in 1990. This program takes a look at this incident from an Aboriginal perspective.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mari Bennett, Rachel Perkins and Blackfella Films
